intro: Gilia achilleifolia var. alba, commonly known as white gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are slender and branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
